row.entry: Keith Campbell, Susan Castillo, Eric Browne, Marc Campbell
updated classifier documentation; hyphenation correction; improved search description; keyboard shortcuts.
refset building and editing improvements; search aids;
autogeneration of Business Process Library documentation from .bp files; additional refset functionality
new chapter - Administrative functions; workflow descriptions - creating new users, managing refsets, wizards and screen forms
revamped chapters: Using the Classifier; Reference sets: refset creation walkthrough
revamped chapters: Reference sets. Added to troubleshooting chapter
explanation of reference set expression clauses; explanation of paths, role permissions; classifier changes
menu changes; difference report; revised search criteria; revised preferences
reformatted Guidebook - split into 3 PDFs (Wbench User Guide; Wbench Business Process Guide; Wbench Developers Guide. new HTML navigation pane

body.p: Â© 2007-2010 International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation. All rights of exploitation in any form and by any means are reserved worldwide for IHTSDO Members.
SNOMED CT was originally created by the College of American Pathologists.

No part of this document may be reproduced or transmitted in any form or by any means, or stored in any kind of retrieval system, except by an Affiliate of the IHTSDO in accordance with the SNOMED CT Affiliate Licence. Any modification of this document (including without limitation the removal or modification of this notice) is prohibited without the express written permission of the IHTSDO. Details of the SNOMED CT Affiliate Licence may be found at .

Any copy of this document that is not obtained directly from the IHTSDO (or a Member of the IHTSDO) is not controlled by the IHTSDO, and may have been modified and may be out of date. Any recipient of this document who has received it by other means is encouraged to obtain a copy directly from the IHTSDO, or a Member of the IHTSDO. (Details of the Members of the IHTSDO may be found at ).

This document contains the user and developer guide for the IHTSDO Terminology Workbench, which is the primary development and management environment for the content of SNOMED CT and related terminology products. The document has been prepared using the Darwin Information Typing Architecture (DITA) Open Toolkit (version 1.5), and may be rendered in various formats, including PDF and HTML.
The document is a revision release for IHTSDO Affiliates.
Significant parts of this document were derived from "The ACE Guidebook", the operations guide for the ACE Toolkit developed by Informatics Inc.

Some chapters have been automatically generated from Workbench application source and binary components - particularly those chapters documenting the the Task Library and the Business Process Library. Consequently, their content may vary from release to release.
